charity.description: RNLI volunteer lifeboat crews provide a 24-hour search and rescue service all around the UK and Ireland, while lifeguards keep a careful watch on the UK’s busiest beaches. RNLI lifesaving and drowning prevention depend on supporter fundraising and the generous donations that you and others give.
charity.name: RNLI - Royal National Lifeboat Institution
story:
Our RNLI lifeboats in Ireland protect hundreds of communities through our 24-hour search and rescue service. They rely on the safest, most reliable lifeboats and modern stations to launch from.

Ireland’s unrivalled coasts and inland waters are valued by local communities and visitors alike, with millions travelling to enjoy them,
and work on them each year. But the water remains an unpredictable environment that can catch people out. People will always need our help and we will always be there to answer that call.

Keeping a modern fleet of lifeboats maintained, fuelled and
ever ready to go to the rescue from all 36 of the lifeboat stations in Ireland is expensive and we rely entirely on voluntary donations to ensure this service is maintained. Add to that crew training and kit, and the euros start to add up. It costs an average of €165k to run lifeboat stations in Ireland but this year, with the implications of Covid-19, we haven’t been able to fundraise to keep our lifeboats afloat.

We rely on donations from you the public to continue saving lives at sea and on inland waters - your donation to this page will help support the running of the following lifeboat stations in Ireland:

Achill Island, Aran Islands, Arklow, Arranmore, Ballycotton, Ballyglass, Baltimore, Bundoran, Castletownbere, Clifden, Clogher Head,
Courtmacsherry Harbour, Courtown, Crosshaven, Dun Laoghaire, Dunmore East, Fenit, Fethard, Galway, Helvick Head, Howth, Kilmore Quay, Kilrush, Kinsale, Lough Derg, Lough Ree, Lough Swilly, Rosslare Harbour, Skerries, Sligo Bay, Tramore, Union Hall, Valentia, Wexford, Wicklow and Youghal

pageSummary: raising funds to support running of our Lifeboat
pageSummaryWhat: raising funds to support running of our Lifeboat
story:
Thank you visiting our Just Giving page. 

Situated on the shores of Belfast Lough, Bangor Lifeboat Station has provided search and rescue cover for the area for over 40 years. The station operates a B Class Atlantic 85 Lifeboat.

Our RNLI lifeboats in N. Ireland protect hundreds of communities through our 24-hour search and rescue service. The volunteer crew rely on the safest, most reliable lifeboats and modern stations to launch from to be able to save lives.

N. Irelands unrivalled coasts and inland waters are valued by local communities and visitors alike. But the water remains an
unpredictable environment that can catch people out. People will always need our help and we will always be there to answer that call.

Keeping our Bangor lifeboat maintained, fuelled and ever ready to go to the rescue is expensive and we rely entirely on voluntary donations to ensure this service is maintained. Add to that crew training and kit, and the pounds start to add up. During the pandemic we have
still been offering a lifesaving service and are continuing to raise vital
funds.

We haven’t been able to take part in our traditional fundraising this year and rely on donations from the public to continue saving lives. Your donation will help support the running of Bangor Lifeboat station and its lifesaving service.

story:
Our RNLI lifeboats in N. Ireland protect hundreds of communities through our 24-hour search and rescue service. The volunteer crew rely on the safest, most reliable lifeboats and modern stations to launch from to be able to save lives.

Larne Lifeboat station was established in 1994 and currently launch into the waters of East Antrim and the North Channel. There is currently an inshore D class lifeboat and an all-weather Trent Lifeboat.

N. Irelands unrivalled coasts and inland waters are valued by local communities and visitors alike. But the water remains an unpredictable environment that can catch people out. People will always need our help and we will always be there to answer that call.

Keeping our Larne lifeboat maintained, fuelled and ever ready to go to the rescue is expensive and we rely entirely on voluntary donations to ensure this service is maintained. Add to that crew training and kit, and the pounds start to add up. During the pandemic we have
still been offering a lifesaving service and are continuing to raise vital
funds.

We haven’t been able to take part in our traditional fundraising this year and rely on donations from the public to continue saving lives. Your donation will help support the running of Larne Lifeboat station and its lifesaving service.

We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. 

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
eventName: Fundraising auction in aid of WWF: Oil paintings by Chris Player
pageSummary: I am hosting a silent auction for 4 oil paintings
pageSummaryWhat: I am hosting a silent auction for 4 oil paintings
story:
I am hosting an online, silent auction to raise awareness and fundraise in aid of WWF. Any contributions you wish to make here are greatly appreciated, and to take part in the auction, please visit my site via the website below. The auction is live 21st-29th November.

www.chrisplayerpaintings.co.uk

WWF is at the heart of global efforts to address the world’s most important environmental challenges: safeguarding the natural world, tackling climate change and enabling people to use only their fair share of natural resources. Together we can build a future where people and nature thrive. Your support is much appreciated. Find out more by visiting wwf.org.uk

charity.description:
We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. 

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
pageSummary: Raising money because I loved the concept of the event.
pageSummaryWhy: I loved the concept of the event.
story:
I loved the idea of this event. At a time when we can’t just pop round and visit our loved ones, I felt this was something to look forward to and do some good in the process.

A  message from WWF:

“IF YOU GO DOWN TO THE WOODS TODAY... You might notice theres less wildlife than there used to be. Thats because half of all UK species are in decline were losing our precious red squirrels, hedgehogs and birds at an alarming rate. By taking part in The Big Winter Wander, you and your friends and family can reconnect with our country's beautiful wildlife and help protect it. The funds you raise will help us campaign to protect wildlife here, and around the world. Nature has been there to offer us comfort during difficult times, and now its our time to give back.”

pageSummary: Raising awareness of wildlife through Sculpture because so many species are at risk of extinction.
pageSummaryWhat: Raising awareness of wildlife through Sculpture
pageSummaryWhy: so many species are at risk of extinction.
story:
This year as an alternative to visiting the Zoology museum Form 5 spent an afternoon learning about the threat of extinction to the White Rhino.

They used clay to make small sculptures of Northern White Rhinos. These are currently on display in the Piazza and we are asking the children if they would like to donate £1 to the World Wide Fund for Nature before they take their sculptures home. 

The WWF is at the frontier of conservation work to save endangered animals from extinction.

pageSummary: I am cycling from Gloucester to Sharpness because I want to help save the coral reefs.
pageSummaryWhat: I am cycling from Gloucester to Sharpness
pageSummaryWhy: I want to help save the coral reefs.
story: Hi, my name is Frank and I'm nine years old. I have done many money raising activities for the animal shelter and I organised a cake sale to raise money for Fairtrade. This time I'm going to do a sponsored cycle ride for coral reef's after being given a heart breaking report by the WWF. I'm going to be cycling with my dad from Gloucester to Sharpness (the sea) which is sixteen miles. Please give support and give some money to help save the coral reefs.

pageSummary: I am raising money because I love all animals
story:
Many animals are becoming extinct all because of humans. And it is unfair for all of them, as we are ruining their lives! There are only around 3900 tigers, and around 1860 giant pandas in the wild. It is really sad that this has happened. We must help, please help me to raise money, I would really appreciate it.

thank you xx

pageSummary: We are cycling because we want to help our world.
pageSummaryWhy: we want to help our world.
story:
Mia and I are Year 7 pupils raising money for our school house charity! We'll be cycling along the Two Tunnels cycle route in Bath on 28th November 2020. We're hoping to do at least 12 miles which is more than we've ever cycled before! 

WWF is at the heart of global efforts to address the world’s most important environmental challenges: safeguarding the natural world, tackling climate change and enabling people to use only their fair share of natural resources. Together we can build a future where people and nature thrive. Please donate, your support is much appreciated. Find out more by visiting wwf.org.uk

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
story: IF YOU GO DOWN TO THE WOODS TODAY... You might notice theres less wildlife than there used to be. Thats because half of all UK species are in decline were losing our precious red squirrels, hedgehogs and birds at an alarming rate. By taking part in The Big Winter Wander, you and your friends and family can reconnect with our country's beautiful wildlife and help protect it. The funds you raise will help us campaign to protect wildlife here, and around the world. Nature has been there to offer us comfort during difficult times, and now its our time to give back.

charity.name: WWF-UK
story:
IF YOU GO DOWN TO THE WOODS TODAY...You might notice there's less wildlife than there used to be. That's because half of all UK species are in decline... we are losing our precious red squirrels, hedgehogs, and birds at an alarming rate. 

The funds raised through our big winter wander will help WWF campaign to protect wildlife here, and around the world. Nature has been there to offer us comfort during difficult times, and now it's our time to give back.

On the 2nd January 2021, we will be walking through the Castle Eden Dene, to the Castle, then to the Inn, which should take around 4 hours.

Anything you can sponsor us will be really appreciated :)
title: The Big Winter Wander
rememberedPersonSummary.name: NA
Name: The Big Winter Wander

charity.description:

charity.name: WWF-UK
pageSummary: Taking part in the Big Winter Wander because Wildlife is in huge danger and needs our help!
pageSummaryWhat: Taking part in the Big Winter Wander
pageSummaryWhy: Wildlife is in huge danger and needs our help!
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Nature and wildlife means so much to many people and is a huge passion of mine. I’m taking part in this walk to help raise awareness of how much British wildlife needs our help. By donating you are protecting not only the animals of Britain, but the plants and different ecosystems.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

pageSummary: Walking the brainbridge 13.4 km route because Raise awareness & funds for our beautiful wildlife
pageSummaryWhy: Raise awareness & funds for our beautiful wildlife
story:
IF YOU GO DOWN TO THE WOODS TODAY... You might notice theres less wildlife than there used to be. Thats because half of all UK species are in decline were losing our precious red squirrels, hedgehogs and birds at an alarming rate. By taking part in The Big Winter Wander, you and your friends and family can reconnect with our country's beautiful wildlife and help protect it. The funds you raise will help us campaign to protect wildlife here, and around the world. Nature has been there to offer us comfort during difficult times, and now its our time to give back.

Join me on my route and/or donate to help with the winter wander land appeal. 

Please share so that as many people as possible can Join in...... 

Thank you for your support ❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

charity.description: Animal Equality is an international farmed animal advocacy organisation that is dedicated to defending all animals through public education, campaigns and investigations.
charity.name: Animal Equality
story:
Hi, 

I'm setting out on a new career path, with the aim to help others create profound change in themselves, their work and their lives. I am training to become a Transformative Life Coach with Animas Centre For Coaching.

Currently, I'm a coaching novice, though as I work through the course and with your help as my coachees, hopefully we'd both have an enlightening experience!

The course requires that students charge for the sessions and that we complete a number of practice hours. There are no strict rules on the number of sessions we do together - we can do just 1 sessions - up to 6.

I will ask for a £15 donation which will all go to Animal Equality.
This small donation to charity will enable me to feel free to experiment and take the pressure off myself whilst I navigate and explore through this new terrain.

Contact me if you're interested! Look forward to working with you.

Marios


Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.name: Oxfam
pageSummary: I offer free hypnotherapy session because I want to help Oxfam in their fabulous mission
pageSummaryWhy: I want to help Oxfam in their fabulous mission
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

This year has been source of stress or anxiety for a lot of people. I decided to dedicate one day per week to help anyone who want to try hypnotherapy.

I see a growing number of clients with

anxiety

,

sleep

or

addiction

issues. If you suffer from similar problems, hypnotherapy can help.


What to do to get a free session ?
Simply contribute to this justgiving page and book an intro session with me here.

https://calendly.com/alexisfr/hypnotherapy-sessions-oxfam


(you don't have to comit to anything after this session)

How much shall I give?
As much as you want! There is no minimum. However, I'd love to reach my target before year-end. Your contribution can be anonymous if you prefer.
(to give an order of comparaison, a session with me is £150)

pageSummary: Getting Welcome to the Black Parade to Xmas No 1 because of this years tragic events and for goodwill
pageSummaryWhat: Getting Welcome to the Black Parade to Xmas No 1
pageSummaryWhy: of this years tragic events and for goodwill
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Are you sick of 2020?

Are you fed up of Ladbaby’s sausage roll shenanigans?

In light of this years events, Welcome to the Black Parade has become more relevant now than in 2006

A solidarity anthem for Christmas Number One is what we need to end this year on a high note and if you donate to Oxfam, you are helping make poverty history as well as giving My Chemical Romance a huge Honor by making their song the Number One Christmas single!

KILLJOYS, MAKE SOME NOISE!

charity.description: Right now, millions of children are in danger. They face violence, disease, hunger and the chaos of war and disaster. Unicef ensures more children get life-saving food, vaccinations, education and protection than anyone else. With your help, we can build a safer world for children. unicef.org.uk
charity.name: Unicef UK
charity.registrationNumber: 1072612 (England & Wales) and SC043677 (Scotland)
story:
While Christmas is a happy, celebratory time for many, it can also be a very difficult time for underprivileged children in the UK and around the world.


UNICEF's work in the festive season is of the upmost importance and as a result of the Coronavirus pandemic, it's more vital than ever.


Please donate if you can.

charity.description: Right now, millions of children are in danger. They face violence, disease, hunger and the chaos of war and disaster. Unicef ensures more children get life-saving food, vaccinations, education and protection than anyone else. With your help, we can build a safer world for children. unicef.org.uk
charity.name: Unicef UK
charity.registrationNumber: 1072612 (England & Wales) and SC043677 (Scotland)
story: Could you go 24 hours without food and be expected to live a normal healthy life? This is a challenge faced daily for approximately 11.3% of the world's population including children. Every minute, more than five child mortalities can be attributed to malnutrition. For those fortunate to survive, malnutrition has detrimental effects on childhood growth and learning abilities. Through FAST 24, Lancaster University students will go without food on 27th November to raise money for UNICEF's emergency food programmes. The United Nation's International Children's Emergency UNICEF is a charity part of the United Nation's Development Group committed to protection of children worldwide. UNICEF provides 80% of the world's life-saving food through its nutrition programmes. With your help, we can help increase access to good nutrition to children worldwide giving them a healthier, happier life.

charity.name: Unicef UK
charity.registrationNumber: 1072612 (England & Wales) and SC043677 (Scotland)
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My father, Greg Tasker, unfortunately passed away on 9th of November. We would request that instead of sending flowers or wreaths donations to charity are made in his memory. 

UNICEF : on retiring from the Marines Dad joined the United Nations. UNICEF focuses on providing humanitarian aid to children in war zones or underdeveloped countries. Dad believed that education was vital to all children’s lives and he funded many children through their schooling whilst he was working in Africa. 
We would appreciate any donations whether it be big or small, all will contribute to my Dads legacy ie ‘putting the world to rights’. 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
title: In memory of Greg Tasker - UNICEF

story:
This year I've decided to do another fundraising challenge - last year I did a sponsored bike ride for another charity.



This year things are a bit different and sponsored bike rides just aren't happening, so instead I've decided to raise funds for UNICEF UK.



 After watching The Long Way Up and Long Way Round on Apple TV and seeing the ways Unicef help children in the many countries the team visited I've decided to try and raise funds for Unicef.



The challenge I've set myself to do is the Cabot Trail Virtual challenge from The Conqueror Event Series.



To do this I have to walk or cycle 185 miles and my Garmin smartwatch will keep track of my mileage.



Due to the covid-19 restrictions, I'm going to be doing this locally in the Shropshire/Worcestershire border.



I intend to start this on the 1st December and do 6 miles every day up to the 31st December to complete it in time for the new year.



I know at the moment times are hard for many people so I thank you in advance for any donation you can afford to help me reach my target of £1,000.

story:
Hello all,

Welcome to our group effort for raising some money for a fantastic cause, whilst also securing the chance to win a fabulous Christmas hamper filled with some great festive goodies! 

Please feel free to donate as little or as much as you like! Entry to be added to the raffle is £5 and you can treble your chances by donating £10. 

The winner will be announced on Friday the 18th of December 2020, and subsequently contacted to share delivery details so you can enjoy your prize!

Merry Christmas to all!

pageSummary: 24 Sun Salutations, 24 mins past the hour, 24hrs
pageSummaryWhat: 24 Sun Salutations, 24 mins past the hour, 24hrs
story:
This year has been so tough on everyone, at home and around the globe, with the impact of Covid-19 taking centre stage. 

It is very difficult to make a choice on who to help, how and in what way, with our own limited resources. We have chosen to raise money for Unicef's Yemen appeal because the horrific events that are occurring there are the world's current worst humanitarian crisis, and the impact of the pandemic will make this even more difficult for children living there. 

So this Christmas Eve, please support us in our 24 hour challenge, which we recognise is nothing compared to what children in Yemen are going through, by donating anything, no matter how small. 

Your support means the world xx

charity.description: Right now, millions of children are in danger. They face violence, disease, hunger and the chaos of war and disaster. Unicef ensures more children get life-saving food, vaccinations, education and protection than anyone else. With your help, we can build a safer world for children. unicef.org.uk
charity.name: Unicef UK
charity.registrationNumber: 1072612 (England & Wales) and SC043677 (Scotland)
story:
At sixth form we will be doing a raffle in our advent charities to raise money for UNICEF UK. To go a step further we decided to start a just giving page for any other donations and to ask those outside of our school to also help us raise as much money as possible for this incredible charity.

UNICEF works in over 190 countries and territories to save children's lives, to defend their rights, and to help them fulfil their potential, from early childhood through adolescence. 

We strongly believe this charity is vital in contemporary society, the global vulnerability of children is a significant issue and has only been made worse due to the global pandemic and with Christmas around the corner these children desperately need our help. Within UNICEF there is also the 'love myself' campaign which aims to provide children and teens the right to pursue a a life of safety and happiness as many fall victim to various forms of violence the money raised can be used to protect these children and teens from violence and encourage preventive measures. Through our fundraising and your help we hope to achieve our goal of making a contribution to the outstanding work UNICEF does for children around the world and shed light on the issues the less fortunate face.

charity.description: Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors Without Borders (MSF) is the world's leading medical humanitarian aid organisation. We work in over 70 countries - in conflict zones, natural disasters and epidemics. We are independent, neutral and impartial. We provide medical care where it's needed most.
charity.name: Medecins Sans Frontieres / Doctors Without Borders (MSF)
story:
Heartsease Blog MSF


A wish for a better world mixed with creativity and kindness is a powerful recipe for creating a song to see us through these corona times. It was these qualities that brought four musicians, an artist and a sound mixing engineer together in a group project through lockdown to create a song to raise funds for Medecins Sans Frontieres,  to help the worlds most vulnerable people at this time.


It is a time of global uncertainty, sickness, death, poverty and despair but our human qualities of kindness, resilience, creativity and collective problem solving will be what sees us through. 



I, the singer songwriter was inspired by the image of a prayer flag which is used to send blessings around the world.  I reckoned that a song works in much the same way so I wrote this song for people to join in the chorus and send collective blessings for healing around the world. By turning it into a video with a donate button it then allows people to help in practical ways too. A dual experience of helping and the action of singing together around the world unites us as a global human family, as ‘we are in it together” and solutions to all the associated corona problems will be addressed more effectively if we can remember this shared humanity.



Creating the song long distance was not without its problems - lack of experience and poor equipment meant there were many hurdles to overcome-  recorded bird song, backfiring motorbikes, an ill tuned recorder to name but a few! The beautiful cover artwork was done as a bespoke project by artist Yuni Ko, in Canada. Three of the musicians and engineer live in and around London but could not meet up and I the singer songwriter live in North East Scotland. Many of us had never met so the whole project relied on digital communication and the commonly held wish that holds this project together.


Once it was finished it took weeks to get it through copyright as everyone at the agency was furloughed and there was no one available to answer questions. Finally the song was ready to launch and Medecins sans Frontieres felt like a good fit as a charitable home for the song. They work across all countries in the places that need it the most for people who need it the most. It is the worlds most vulnerable that need the most help and so we hope that this song for a good cause will contribute in raising funds for their tireless efforts in helping people.


As the song's creators, we have decided to set up a band as a result of working on this song together. We are calling the band Karuna, which is Sanskrit for compassion. It feels an apt name for a band that is born out of this crazy time and a wonderful piece of creativity at an otherwise fairly barren time. We will work together around the nucleus of my other songs and will start by creating a song cycle inspired by this time called “Songs for Our Time.’ Our new band logo is another piece of artwork by Yuni Ko alongside the cover artwork for the song. 


I have called the song “Heartsease” as it is my wish for our hearts to have a little collective healing and peace through joining in the song. May it rekindle a calmness and a hope and care for each other at this time and bring a little light. And, like the lyric line in the song may we “pass the flicker from hand to hand” and send it around the world to create ripples of healing and help.

eventName: Raffle - 'Story of Fabric' Upcycled Advent Calendar
story:
In a combined bid to use up my fabric scraps and raise money for Medecins Sans Frontieres / Doctors Without Borders (MSF), I have made this ‘Story of Fabric’ advent calendar, celebrating the interesting, unusual and sometimes amusing story/ origin of each fabric scrap.

To be in with a chance of winning this calendar and be delighted/amused everyday in December, please:

  1. Purchase a virtual raffle ticket by donating an amount of your choice
  2. Email me your name and preferred contact details should you win to meganpadmastuart@hotmail.com

Each donation will count as one raffle entry, no matter how small or large, and a winner will be randomly drawn and announced on 25th November. If the winner doesn’t respond to the message on their preferred contact after 24 hours, a name will be redrawn. 

Once you donate, Just Giving will send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Love Mog x

Abi Rooley-Towle

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
charity.registrationNumber: 288701 (England and Wales) and SC039479 (Scotland)
story:
In support of World Toilet Day on 19th November 
Raising awareness of and inspire action to tackle the global sanitation crisis.

Clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene should be a normal part of everyone’s daily life. Without all three, people can’t live dignified, healthy lives. With all three, they can unlock their potential, break free from poverty and change their lives for good. With clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene, children are born healthier. They get the chance to go to school and grow up to become adults. Women and men get to earn a living. Whole communities start to thrive. It sounds normal and it should be.

eventName: Leaving Thames Water to join Tideway
pageSummary: Leaving Thames and saying thank you because it's something that we all relate to at Thames
pageSummaryWhat: Leaving Thames and saying thank you
pageSummaryWhy: it's something that we all relate to at Thames
story:
During my time at Thames Water I have learned the importance of delivering clean water both here in the UK and the rest of the world.  Especially to those less fortunate than ourselves.

I have been asked about leaving presents and my answer is the best present that you can give me (even if it is 50 pence or less) is a donation to WaterAid.  Your donation will go to help those less fortunate than ourselves who need clean drinking water for their survival and any donation will also make me happy.

Thanks and good luck to you all in your future careers at Thames and the world outside.  For me I have enjoyed working with a great group of people and look forward to joining Tideway, where I will be collaborating with you to deliver "London's super sewer".

Steve

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
charity.registrationNumber: 288701 (England and Wales) and SC039479 (Scotland)
pageSummary: I am fundraising because I want to help people get access to clean water
pageSummaryWhy: I want to help people get access to clean water
story:
Clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene should be a normal part of everyone’s daily life. Without all three, people can’t live dignified, healthy lives. With all three, they can unlock their potential, break free from poverty and change their lives for good. 

Give before 4 February 2021 and, as part of our Future on Tap campaign, your donation will be doubled by the UK government, up to £2 million, making double the difference. Together, we will bring clean water to 50,000 people in Ethiopia and thousands more around the world.

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
charity.registrationNumber: 288701 (England and Wales) and SC039479 (Scotland)
story:
Clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene should be a normal part of everyone’s daily life. 

Without all three, people can’t live dignified, healthy lives. With all three, they can unlock their potential, break free from poverty and change their lives for good.

With clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene, children are born healthier. They get the chance to go to school and grow up to become adults. Women and men get to earn a living. Whole communities start to thrive. 

It sounds normal and it should be.

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
charity.registrationNumber: 288701 (England and Wales) and SC039479 (Scotland)
story: I am challenging myself to drink nothing but water this January. I am taking on the ultimate detox by avoiding caffeine, alcohol and all other drinks while supporting WaterAid. Give before 4 February 2021 and your donation will be doubled by the UK government, up to £2 million, making double the difference in communities across Ethiopia. Together, we will bring clean water to 50,000 people in Ethiopia and thousands more around the world, helping them change their own lives, forever. If you would like further information about the difference your gift will make and the positive impact it will have on peoples lives, please visit us at www.wateraid.org/uk
